title: Ticket #5517: Incorrect error message in condor_store_cred
description:
condor_store_cred gives "Operation failed. Make sure your ALLOW_WRITE setting includes this host" when the remote operation fails, even if it fails for a reason unrelated to ALLOW_WRITE. For example: 

PS H:\> condor_store_cred add -d -n scheduler.examplecom
Account: bcotton@mydomain

Enter password:

02/16/16 12:11:28 STORE_CRED: In mode 'add'
02/16/16 12:11:06 STORE_CRED: In mode 'add'
02/16/16 12:11:06 Can't find address for schedd scheduler.example.com
02/16/16 12:11:06 STORE_CRED: Failed to start command.
02/16/16 12:11:06 STORE_CRED: Unable to contact the REMOTE schedd.
Operation failed.
    Make sure your ALLOW_WRITE setting includes this host.

So condor_store_cred has some degree of knowledge as to why the action failed, but that's not presented to the user by default.
remarks:
2019-Nov-26 09:57:26 by matyas:
This also happens when the directory the password is in does not exist. On an 8.9.4 RPM install, the default password directory (/etc/condor/password.d) needs to be created by the user, so this is likely to happen.
